hasAccessToNode

public static boolean hasAccessToNode(Node node,
                                      User user)
Checks if a user has access to a node. A node is by definition restricted, if it has any usergroup associated. A node is also restricted if any parent node (from the current node to the top node) is restricted. A node can have different restrictions than any parent node. In this case the node is visible to the users that are in the same group as the node.

Parameters:
node - the node to check the access for
user - the user to check
Returns:
true if the user has access, false if not

locateNodeByName

public static Node locateNodeByName(java.lang.String name)
Locates a node by its name or its full path. This method is needed in order to resolve a given path from an url.

Parameters:
name - the name or the path of the node to be found.
Returns:
the found node or null if nothing was found

findMatchingNodes

public static final java.util.List<?> findMatchingNodes(java.lang.String searchString,
                                                        javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                                        javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response,
                                                        java.lang.ClassLoader loader,
                                                        java.lang.String username)
Performs a fulltext search with a given search string within all existing text nodes and all existent plugin nodes. This method is needed because the nodes are not indexed at all.

Parameters:
searchString - the string to search for
request - the current servlet request (this is needed because the plugins have to be initalized with the current request)
loader - the current classloader (this is needed because the plugins have to be initalized with the current classloader)
username - the username is needed for skipping restricted nodes
Returns:
a list of matching nodes if there are any.

getChildNodes

public static void getChildNodes(java.util.ArrayList<Node> nodes,
                                 Node node)
